item.name: Firmware Version
item.description: Installed LANTIME firmware version.

item.name: Total Clients
item.description: Total number of different clients requesting time.

item.name: Statistic Start Time
item.description: Start time of current NTP client counter session as timestamp.

item.name: Total Today's Clients
item.description: Today's number of different clients requesting time.

item.name: Total Requests
item.description: Total requests since starting of the daemon.

item.name: Total Requests Today
item.description: Today's total requests

item.name: Total Requests Last Hour
item.description: Today's requests within the last completed hour.

item.name: Total Requests Last Minute
item.description: Today's requests within the last completed minute.

item.name: NTP Status
item.description: Current NTP's synchronization status.

item.name: NTP Reference Clock
item.description: Name of the current refclock by the NTP.

item.name: NTP Reference Clock Offset
item.description: Time offset between the current selected refclock and time of NTP as string in milliseconds

item.name: NTP Stratum
item.description: Stratum value of the NTP.

item.name: Serial Number
item.description: LANTIME serial number.

item.name: Temperature
item.description: Temperature in degree Celsius

item_prototype.name: PTP Module - {#SNMPVALUE} - Availability
item_prototype.description: Signals whether PTP instance is avail or not

item_prototype.name: PTP Module - {#SNMPVALUE} - Clock Class
item_prototype.description: Denotes the traceability of the time or frequency

item_prototype.name: PTP Module - {#SNMPVALUE} - UTC Offset
item_prototype.description: Offset from PTP's TAI time to UTC time

item_prototype.name: Reference Clock - {#SNMPVALUE} - Additional Information
item_prototype.description: Any kind of additional information concerning a refclock

item_prototype.name: Reference Clock - {#SNMPVALUE} - Status Value A MAX
item_prototype.description: Maximum status A depending on reflcock gps :indicates number of satellites in view long wave -pzf :100 -other :not supported irig :not supported

item_prototype.name: Reference Clock - {#SNMPVALUE} - Status Value B MAX
item_prototype.description: Maximum status B depending on reflcock gps :not supported long wave -all :100 irig :not supported

item_prototype.name: Reference Clock - {#SNMPVALUE} - State
item_prototype.description: State of GPS refclock conneted to NTP time server as value 0:not available 1:synchronized 2:not synchronized

item_prototype.name: Reference Clock - {#SNMPVALUE} - Status Value A
item_prototype.description: Status A depending on reflcock gps :indicates number of good satellites in view long wave -pzf :correlation -other :not supported irig :not supported

item_prototype.name: Reference Clock - {#SNMPVALUE} - Status Value B
item_prototype.description: Status B depending on reflcock gps :not supported long wave -all :field strength irig :not supported

item_prototype.name: Reference Clock - {#SNMPVALUE} - Substate
item_prototype.description: More detailed state depending on refclock type 0:no substate available gps:1-4 long waves (PZF,WWVB,MSF,...):50-52 (not supported by all types) irig:100-101

item_prototype.name: Reference Clock - {#SNMPVALUE} - Usage
item_prototype.description: what this refclock is used for

item_prototype.name: Utilization of processor #$1
item_prototype.description: The average, over the last minute, of the percentage of time that this processor was not idle. Implementations may approximate this one minute smoothing period if necessary.

template.name: Template Module Generic SNMP
template.description:
Template Module Generic
MIBs used: SNMPv2-MIB
Template tooling version used: 0.36

item.name: SNMP traps (fallback)
item.description: Item is used to collect all SNMP traps unmatched by other snmptrap items

item.name: System contact details
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The textual identification of the contact person for this managed node, together with information on how to contact this person. If no contact information is known, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: System description
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB A textual description of the entity. This value should include the full name and version identification of the system's hardware type, software operating-system, and networking software.

item.name: System location
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The physical location of this node (e.g., `telephone closet, 3rd floor'). If the location is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: System name
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB An administratively-assigned name for this managed node.By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

trigger.name: System name has changed (new name: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger.description: System name has changed. Ack to close.

item.name: System object ID
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The vendor's authoritative identification of the network management subsystem contained in the entity. This value is allocated within the SMI enterprises subtree (1.3.6.1.4.1) and provides an easy and unambiguous means for determining`what kind of box' is being managed. For example, if vendor`Flintstones, Inc.' was assigned the subtree1.3.6.1.4.1.4242, it could assign the identifier 1.3.6.1.4.1.4242.1.1 to its `Fred Router'.

item.name: Uptime
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The time (in hundredths of a second) since the network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.

trigger.name: No SNMP data collection
trigger.description: SNMP is not available for polling. Please check device connectivity and SNMP settings.

trigger.name: Unavailable by ICMP ping
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Last three attempts returned timeout. Please check device connectivity.

dependency.name: High ICMP ping loss
dependency.expression: {Template Module ICMP Ping:icmppingloss.min(5m)}>{$ICMP_LOSS_WARN} and {Template Module ICMP Ping:icmppingloss.min(5m)}<100

template.name: Template Module Interfaces SNMP
template.description:
Template Module Interfaces
MIBs used: IF-MIB
Template tooling version used: 0.36

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Inbound packets discarded
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Inbound packets with errors
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of inbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Bits received
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets received on the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of ifInOctets. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Outbound packets discarded
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Outbound packets with errors
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of outbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of outbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Bits sent
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of ifOutOctets.Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Speed
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB An estimate of the interface's current bandwidth in units of 1,000,000 bits per second. If this object reports a value of `n' then the speed of the interface is somewhere in the range of `n-500,000' to`n+499,999'. For interfaces which do not vary in bandwidth or for those where no accurate estimation can be made, this object should contain the nominal bandwidth. For a sub-layer which has no concept of bandwidth, this object should be zero.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Operational status
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The current operational state of the interface. - The testing(3) state indicates that no operational packet scan be passed - If ifAdminStatus is down(2) then ifOperStatus should be down(2) - If ifAdminStatus is changed to up(1) then ifOperStatus should change to up(1) if the interface is ready to transmit and receive network traffic - It should change todormant(5) if the interface is waiting for external actions (such as a serial line waiting for an incoming connection) - It should remain in the down(2) state if and only if there is a fault that prevents it from going to the up(1) state - It should remain in the notPresent(6) state if the interface has missing(typically, hardware) components.

trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
trigger_prototype.description:
This trigger expression works as follows: 1. Can be triggered if operations status is down. 2. {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down. 3. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)
WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Interface type
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The type of interface. Additional values for ifType are assigned by the Internet Assigned NumbersAuthority (IANA), through updating the syntax of the IANAifType textual convention.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Module Interfaces SNMP:net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].change()}<0 and {Template Module Interfaces SNMP:net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}>0 and ( {Template Module Interfaces SNMP:net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=6 or {Template Module Interfaces SNMP:net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=7 or {Template Module Interfaces SNMP:net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=11 or {Template Module Interfaces SNMP:net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=62 or {Template Module Interfaces SNMP:net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=69 or {Template Module Interfaces SNMP:net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=117 ) and ({Template Module Interfaces SNMP:net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}<>2)
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: ({Template Module Interfaces SNMP:net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].change()}>0 and {Template Module Interfaces SNMP:net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].prev()}>0) or ({Template Module Interfaces SNMP:net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=2)
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Ethernet has changed to lower speed than it was before
trigger_prototype.description: This Ethernet connection has transitioned down from its known maximum speed. This might be a sign of autonegotiation issues. Ack to close.

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Template Module Interfaces SNMP:net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=2 and {Template Module Interfaces SNMP:net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].diff()}=1)

trigger_prototype.expression: ({Template Module Interfaces SNMP:net.if.in[ifHCInOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(15m)}>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*{Template Module Interfaces SNMP:net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()} or {Template Module Interfaces SNMP:net.if.out[ifHCOutOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(15m)}>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*{Template Module Interfaces SNMP:net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}) and {Template Module Interfaces SNMP:net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}>0
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: {Template Module Interfaces SNMP:net.if.in[ifHCInOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(15m)}<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*{Template Module Interfaces SNMP:net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()} and {Template Module Interfaces SNMP:net.if.out[ifHCOutOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(15m)}<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*{Template Module Interfaces SNMP:net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High bandwidth usage (> {$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}% )
trigger_prototype.description: The network interface utilization is close to its estimated maximum bandwidth.

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Template Module Interfaces SNMP:net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=2 and {Template Module Interfaces SNMP:net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].diff()}=1)

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Template Module Interfaces SNMP:net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=2 and {Template Module Interfaces SNMP:net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].diff()}=1)

macro.description: Filter out loopbacks, nulls, docker veth links and docker0 bridge by default
